data.title: Clark County
data.text:
Department One

Honorable Nancy N. Retsinas

564.397.2315

A Vancouver native, Judge Retsinas received her bachelor degree from University of Portland and her law degree from University of Oregon. She was in private practice for 29 years before Governor Jay Inslee appointed her to the Bench in July 2021.

Department Two

Honorable David E. Gregerson

564.397.2248

Born and raised in Vancouver, Judge Gregerson received his B.A. from Pepperdine University and his J.D. from Vanderbilt University. He was in private practice for 20 years before being elected to the Superior Court bench in August 2012.

Department Five

Honorable Camara L. J. Banfield

564.397.4221

Judge Banfield, a native Vancouverite, graduated from the University of Oregon for both undergraduate and law school. She began her legal career at the Vancouver City Attorney’s Office and was hired by the Clark County Prosecuting Attorney’s Office in 2004. Judge Banfield was appointed to the bench by Governor Inslee in 2021.

Department Six

Honorable John P. Fairgrieve

564.397.2005

Judge Fairgrieve has a Bachelor of Arts degree from the University of California, Berkeley, a master's degree in strategic studies from the U.S. Army War College, and a law degree from the University of Oregon School of Law. He served as a deputy prosecuting attorney in the Clark County Prosecuting Attorney’s Office from November 1994 to April 2015. Judge Fairgrieve also served as an officer in the U.S. Marine Corps on active duty and in the reserve from 1983 to 2013. He retired from the U.S. Marine Corps Reserve in 2013 at the rank of colonel. He was appointed to the bench by Governor Jay Inslee in April 2015.

Department Seven

Honorable Jennifer K. Snider

564.397.6133

A graduate of Whitman College and Gonzaga School of Law, Judge Snider practiced family law and dependency for 17 years before being appointed as a full-time court commissioner in August 2013. She was appointed to the court as a judge in April 2019.

Department Ten

Honorable Tsering D. Cornell

564.397.2170

Judge Cornell was born and raised in the Pacific Northwest and has deep roots in Clark County, having attended K-12 school here. Judge Cornell earned her bachelor’s degree from Dartmouth College and her law degree from the University of California, Hastings College of the Law. She began her legal career in private practice before joining the Washington State Attorney General’s Office. Judge Cornell was appointed to the bench by Governor Jay Inslee in 2022.

Department Eleven

Honorable Emily A. Sheldrick

564.397.2017

Judge Sheldrick received her Bachelor of Arts from Oregon State University and law degree from the University of Washington School of Law. Judge Sheldrick was in private practice for 18 years before joining the Civil Division of the Clark County Prosecuting Attorney’s Office in 2014. She was appointed to the bench by Governor Inslee and began her position in January 2021.
